user_sentiment: Moderately satisfied but continuation-focused; the user acknowledges the fix implicitly by moving to the next issue rather than expressing explicit approval, indicating the work was acceptable but not remarkable.
execution_quality: Good execution with proper investigation; the agent systematically located the problematic category definition, understood the filtering logic, and made a targeted fix. However, 4 errors during editing suggest some friction in applying the changes.
work_category: Bug fix for application category classification logic. The agent identified and corrected a regex pattern that was miscategorizing apps into the social media category.
summary: The agent successfully fixed the social media category misconfiguration through systematic debugging and targeted regex correction. The execution was largely autonomous and on-target, though some editing friction occurred. The user's pivot to new issues suggests satisfaction with the fix but indicates there are deeper tracking problems (Kindle/Reading) and UX improvements needed, requiring continued iteration.
follow_up_pattern: User pivoted to two new issues: (1) Kindle app not tracking Reading category time despite foreground/background events, and (2) request to display per-app usage on activity details page. This is typical feature iteration following a bug fix.
